reviews.sentence: can not recommend. As a seasoned travelling family we have stayed at MANY hotels over the years and have yet to experience such a poor stay. Yes it is well located hence the price otherwise you are not getting what you pay for. The newly renovated lobby nice but deceiving. Our room had an unwelcoming stench which resembled damp mouldy air. A bra left behind from the previous guest found on the floor by the pull out sofa bed had me wondering what type of cleaning standards are acceptable here and who checks the rooms to ensure standards are met. We asked for a fourth bath towel as we are a family of four we waited nearly an hour and had to share towels as it never came and we had dinner reservations and had to leave. The sofa bed was not useable as it was thin with springs sticking out of it. The next morning we headed down to the Starbucks bistro and ordered breakfast waited 45 mins for a few eggs and French toast. Another guest noted how unimpressed they were considering housekeeping forgot to clean their room. Needless to say we were happy to check out and are disappointed that being part of the Mariot chain we did not get what we paid for unles what you really pay for is location as that is all that was beneficial. I have read you are undergoing renovations this year much needed perhaps after the fact it will be worth it at this point I just can not recommend.

Honeymoon. Perfect location. Close to restaurants shopping and most importantly the beach. The foyer is updated and modern and very welcoming. The room was comfortable. It could use some updating but it was clean and comfy. Staff was welcoming and pleasant. Will definitely be returning in our travels.

Great location excellent staff. Staff was beyond helpful and friendly. Went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Could not have asked for nicer people. The beds and pillows were great as well. The location is unbeatable. Rooms looked a bit old and could use a bit of updating.
Comfortable stay great location. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms need updating.

This hotel and area is awful. Do not stay here with a family. There are multiple strips clubs directly across the street from the hotel entrance. There are drunks homeless drug addicts wandering all over in front of the hotel as well. The hotel itself is old dirty and the rooms have not been updated in a long time. The pool is nothing like in the pictures and is bland depressing and small. There is no complimentary breakfast parking is over 30 dollars a day and is off site. The walk to the beach is littered with garbage and typical south beach trash.

Good location at South Beach. it is location is very good close to Lincoln mall and asleep a short walking distance to the beach. However the hotel is a bit old and needs some update. The staff is very nice and friendly.

Property needs renovations by far the worst Courtyard I ever stayed at. locationrom was horrible very small with a terrible view very old bathroom leaking shower yellow liquid dropping from the room above in the bathroom.
Soso Website looked better but they are remodeling. Swimingpol on the roof is nice so come back when they are done renovating.

Perfect if you enjoy being woke by drills. Stayed here overnight on a trip to miami from orlando the hotel is OK in a good location close to shops bars and the beach. Roof top pool is a novelty however valeting staff are rather rude. We stayed on the third floor and contractors were renovating the floor above we were not warned about this at any point. Driling and hammering started at 730am and continued until it was time to check out. Emailed the hotel regarding this and did nt even have my complaint awknowleged. Average hotel but would not stay again.

Small hotel and rooms. Very small hotel in South Beach in which the rooms are quite small but updated overall there is places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. It does cost 38 a day to park your car keep that in mind if considering.

Very nice staff large rooms. A very good place to stay in Miami Beach. The front end staff was very pleasant as we arrived early in the morning after arriving back from a cruise. The rooms are all being renovated and are very nice large and clean. A nice place to stay.

A great stay. Stayed for one night. Wished it was more. For the location it was an excellent price and would return with a heartbeat. Room was recently renovated and was spotless and very comfortable. Great value for money and all staff were excellent.

Lovely staff well appointed clean rooms. The staff here are very friendly. The hotel is well located and the rooms are spacious and newly renovated everything is very clean. The breakfast is very odd do not include it as an option it is very limitedThe pool is on the roof and is beautiful the seating area is luxurious sadly the pool is freezing.

Stayed in a newly renovated room which was very spacious and clean. Hotel is situated near many great dining options and the beach. Not there is a club next door so you are going to b hear some music from outside. At least I did.

Very good location if you are not on ocean. Close to walk to Ocean Dr and Collins. Park and walk if you drive in or uber. Close to Mangos restaurants clubs and more. Had corner room in front of hotel. Great room nicely updated. Very nice staff. It is not quiet at night on a weekend in South Beach Miami due to location.

Short and sweet. From the moment I contacted the hotel to confirm my reservation Rachel assisted my and was able to anticipate my needs. Stayed here for 2 nights during Labor day and was able to check in to my room earlier than expected. Joe from Guest Services was great. He was very accommodating with our room preference and engaged with every guest that walked through the lobby area. All guest rooms have been recently renovated and they have a lovely rooftop pool. Wena at the Front Office was also very kind and always inquired about how our stay was. Last but not least the General Manager Jesica was also very pleasant and the hotel staff is lucky to be under her great leadership.
Okay hotel. For families be aware it is across from a strip club. Staff is friendly rooms are updated. Close to a lot in South Beach.
My husband and I spent a night for Art Basel this year and had an extremely pleasant experience at this hotel. Nicely renovated Great location and the staff was fantastic.

Enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect for us. It is a few blocks from Lincoln Mall the beach Ocean Drive and Espanola Way. Our room was spacious the renovation is lovely. It has a rooftop pool but we did not check it out. The desk clerk working Christmas Day was so cheerful. I loved her attitude. There is a parking garage across the street for half the price of the hotel. We would definitely stay here our next trip.

Love the Remodel. Last time I stayed here it was after the place came under new management and the remodel was just beginning. I love how far the hotel has come. Mr Joe as I called him was the SWEETEST man you will ever meet. he is well versed in the area after living there for so long and offers great places to eat. A genuine person who loves what he does. I had an issue with my TV in the first room they gave me after attempting to fix it twice they moved me to another room. It was a little smaller than the original but not a deal breaker. Beds have definitely been upgraded since the last visit. They are way more comfortable and on brand with what you can expect from the brand itself. I was close to the laundry room or the housekeeping area so I had the luxury of hearing the machines start stop and buzzers. Great location. Lincoln rd is right near the hotel and the beach is only two blocks away. Only downfall is no free breakfast.
